text: IFC drawings, sections, and layout plan reviewed and staked
Concrete mix design (strength, slump, air content) approved by consultant or municipality
Accessibility features (slopes, detectable warning pads) detailed and approved
Subgrade compacted and proof rolled with no soft spots
Forms installed true to line/grade with proper slope for drainage
Expansion joints, dowels, and keyways placed where required
Rebar or mesh installed with correct spacing and chair support
Sleeves/conduits for utilities or light poles installed before pour
Concrete placed within time and temperature window (CSA A23.1 compliance)
Slump, air, and temperature tests performed at start of pour
Surface finished per spec (broom, smooth, etc.) with control joints cut or tooled
Curb face and radii troweled smoothly with no honeycombing
Curing compound applied or wet burlap/plastic used within 30 mins of finish
Barriers or flags in place to prevent damage from foot or vehicle traffic
Final inspection completed for slope, elevation, cracks, and finish
